publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The vvhipper of the satyre his pennance in a white sheete: or, The beadles confutation
monogr.author: Guilpin, Edward

div.head: TO ALL IVDICIALL CENSVRERS.
div.l: BRaue sp'rited Gentles, on whose comely from
The Rose of fauour sits Maiestica • l,
I bend the stubborne Atlas of sterne wroth.
But for the fau'rus of a b • st • rd quill,
The instrument of a poore Beadles rage:
I greete them with a careles mindes resolue,
Trueth feares no touch, ne dreades presumptions scourge;
Pr • ud Tyrany by vsurpation
C • nnot depose inuested Veritie:
Ʋaile Bonnet then insulting Tamberlayne;
At least a Monarch: if the Satyrs Whip
He must be carted t • en, for Pride must mount.
Marry an • shall; but weele no Bazons tang:
Yes yes at any hand; Ile tell y • u why,
If all be whist, we shall w • nt company.
Then Pride will faint: Oh haue a care to that,
For if he ride not in his glorious pompe,
It is no gl • ry: Therefore a Doung-cart Ho'e,
To glut the world vvith greater admiration,
For thinges of vvorth feed all mens expectation.
But vvorthy Readers of my vvorthles Writ,
As Writers onely ayme to please the Wise,
So my endeuour is to lodge content
Within the closet of iudiciall hartes.
Iudge then aright, and vvith supposes helpe
Strengthen my imperfection, vvhere Art vvantes
Reason shall leud supply: imagin then
You s • e the Satyrs Whipper in his pride,
Drawne by an Infant of a Satyrist:
Who though he hath receiued many a ierke,
Read with what patience he susteynes that yoke:
• ut if y • u finde him out of order tripping,
Dispence with him that's subiect vnto whipping.
